availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas B. Moss (Green County, Kentucky, overseer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, overseer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary F. Moss in Green County, Kentucky, on October 2, 1857. Father of Emma R. Moss, Eliza B. Moss, Joseph A. Moss, and Benjamin T. Moss. Resident of Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1850. Overseer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 50B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 573-4.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Covington Precinct, p. 99B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Green County Marriages, Film 000594644.
"Thomas B. Moss (1834-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial 47207443, accessed March 3, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47207443.
